OOC:  The hairball thing was a one time gag, I have three cats at home and =
don't mind me, just a little feline humor from a dedicated cat person.

BIC=
:

Nightshift grins sheepishly, and checks over his systems.

"Oh ok, I see=
.  This hair ball was not supposed ta be coughed up, it's supposed ta come =
from my paw, under my paw pad.  It's registering as a probe of some sort."
=

He subspaces the defective probe in his left paw under the pad and ejects =
a new one from a pad under one of the smaller digits of his paws.

" defect=
ive probe, go figure?  Ok, so if this works, this little probe might just g=
ive us the intel we need.  "

He lets the tiny probe go in an attempt to gr=
ab data.

Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for things y=
ou already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends.

On Nov =
17, 2011, at 5:37 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > =
<OLD>
> >
> > Nightshift slowly walks up but sits down a safe distance from=
 the beam. He
> > knew better than to attempt tripping the system.
> >
> > =
" Slag, I knew it. Ain't gonna be easy that's for sure. Normally I'd say
> =
> we get inta the vent system , but that could be bugged too. Maan I wish I=

> > had a nano droid."
> >
> > He starts to get a tickle in his throat tha=
t gets more bothersome by the
> > second. In no time it almost appears as i=
f he's choking, as he wretches to
> > try and clear his airway. And then wi=
th a final, and forceful cough, he
> > spits out a sphere covered with blac=
k fur, and a tiny flashing beacon
> > inside.
> >
> > It surprises him as h=
e looks to Batscout.
> >
> > " What the pit just came outa me?"
> 
> The be=
am that BATSCOUT had focused on the door has been shut off,
> there are no =
other beams present in or around the door.
> 
> The two intrepid travelers =
are still standing at the end of a long
> underground tunnel, the one that =
ran under the nearly frozen lake that
> everyone saw from above. There is n=
o sign of vents or air ducts or any
> other modern convenience, even lights=
 are absent, except for the one
> that BATSCOUT is shining to illuminate th=
e door.
> 
> The walls appear to be made of stone and rock carved out of th=
e earth
> itself. There is even an earthy smell to the place, occasionally
=
> insects scuttle around now that BATSCOUT's light is here to illuminate
> =
things.
> 
> There is no other way to go. Either they go through the door o=
r they
> go back the way they just came.
> 
> Red scanning beams focus on t=
he black object that NIGHTSHIFT coughed
> up. "It would appear to be a hair=
ball." BATSCOUT said in his soft
> computerized voice. "A hairball with sta=
nge unidentified electrical
> componants." The scanning beam shuts off.
> 
=
> OOC: Please do not have characters cough up all the stuff they need.
> Ni=
ghtshift could try pulling out electronic lockpicks, I am sure that
> that =
would be standard for a ninja/thiefly type person like
> Nightshift. A smal=
l probe or two would not be out of the question
> either. So long as they a=
re not too large or over powered. :)
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-D3EF7597-AF57-4EA6-92E1-AA23AC44F048

hat gets more bothersome by the<br>

ears as if he's choking, as he wretches to<br>

y.   And then with a final, and forceful cough, he<br>

ere covered with black fur, and a tiny flashing beacon<br>

" What the pit just came outa me?"<br>
<br>
The beam that BATSCOUT had focu=
sed on the door has been shut off,<br>
there are no other beams present in =
or around the door.<br>
<br>
The two intrepid travelers are still standing =
at the end of a long<br>
underground tunnel, the one that ran under the nea=
rly frozen lake that<br>
everyone saw from above. There is no sign of vents=
 or air ducts or any<br>
other modern convenience, even lights are absent, =
except for the one<br>
that BATSCOUT is shining to illuminate the door.<br>=

<br>
The walls appear to be made of stone and rock carved out of the earth=
<br>
itself. There is even an earthy smell to the place, occasionally<br>
i=
nsects scuttle around now that BATSCOUT's light is here to illuminate<br>
t=
hings.<br>
<br>
There is no other way to go. Either they go through the doo=
r or they<br>
go back the way they just came.<br>
<br>
Red scanning beams f=
ocus on the black object that NIGHTSHIFT coughed<br>
up. "It would appear t=
o be a hairball." BATSCOUT said in his soft<br>
computerized voice. "A hair=
ball with stange unidentified electrical<br>
componants." The scanning beam=
 shuts off.<br>
<br>
OOC: Please do not have characters cough up all the st=
uff they need.<br>
Nightshift could try pulling out electronic lockpicks, I=
 am sure that<br>
that would be standard for a ninja/thiefly type person li=
ke<br>
Nightshift. A small probe or two would not be out of the question<br=
>
either. So long as they are not too large or over powered. :)<br>
